comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: St. Patrick's is the national cathedral of Ireland and one of the more complete medieval buildings in the city.  Dublin rejoices in two cathedrals (this one and Christchurch).  There is no Roman Catholic Cathedral - the Pro-Cathedral near O'Connell Street being designated instead.  The RC church over-reached itself and purchased Merrion Square Park to build one there in the 60s.  In a remarkable display of spine the city fathers refused planning permission for a hideous structure in one of the most complete Georgian Squares in Western Europe.  Given the recent lack of morality of the RC Church it seems unlikely that there will ever be a RC Cathedral.
